results.title: A Place Called Mooroopna
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Adrian Boddington and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: Documents a young Scottish migrant’s arrival to Melbourne and his subsequent journey with his new found Aussie mate around Australia. They visit Portsea and travel through various country areas of Victoria finally stopping at Mooroopna when their car breaks down. The Scotsman gets a job at Mooroopna in the local Ardmona Fruit Cannery for the season. The film shows the making of cans and the processing and canning of the peach and pear crops.

results.title: Every Inch Australian
results.creator_credit: Roland Litchfield, Litchfield Films and ACTIL
results.brief_description: Gives a complete picture of processes used in the manufacture of cotton sheeting at the Actil plant at Woodville, South Australia. Emphasis is placed on the scientific control and checking of all production processes from the arrival of bales of raw cotton to the final packing of Actil products and their despatch to all parts of Australia.

results.title: Bush and beach around Melbourne
results.brief_description:
This film is made up of various scenes of coastal and bush areas in and around Victoria: life saving display at St. Kilda; some views around the beaches to Portsea; bathers and motor boating across the bay to Queenscliff; into the nearest ranges, fields of daffodils around Healesville, Marysville and Warburton districts; gun-dogs in action; fly-fishing; the Dandenong ranges.
No credits available.

results.title: Seaside holiday
results.brief_description: A motoring holiday along some of Victoria’s most beautiful coast roads, introducing some of the scenic beauties to be found along the highways which skirt the ocean beaches of this State.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A survey of the use of gas in commercial cooking and industrial establishments. The film includes glimpses of what happens “behind the menu” at establishments like the Menzies Hotel, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, the canteen at General Motors and a biscuit factory.

results.title: Wharfies: A History of the Waterside Worker's Federation
results.brief_description: Wharfies traces the history of the Australian Waterside Workers Federation from its foundation in 1902, under Billy Hughes, to the present day. Made in the tradition of the Waterside Workers Film Unit of the 1950s, “Wharfies” covers important historical events including industrial milestones, political crises and the stories of the men themselves. This film is pieced together through dramatised sequences, interviews with veteran wharfies and rare archival footage. Cartoons, news clippings and old photographs all help to tell the story.

results.title: Soldier settlers
results.brief_description: Portrays the progress made since 1945 in the establishment of ex-servicemen from World War II on Victorian land. The division of large estates, the development of existing pastures, the clearing of scrub country and the construction of irrigation channels are seen on representative farms throughout the state. Fruit growing, the dried fruit industry, wheat cultivation and sheep raising, plus dry and irrigated dairying are shown, in addition to the single-unit farm system.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.

results.title: Victoria : The First 150 Years
results.creator_credit: Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.
results.description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.
